title: PSA For all you bronzie junglers out there.
body:
No its not ok if you let the enemy team take 3 fucking infernals.

Yes you are the reason we lost by giving them 3 infernals.

No i dont care how many kills you got, you gave them 124% gold efficiency for damage items thats why we lost every team fight after those drags happened.

replies.body:
Heu man. Your point os valid. As i was not in your game i cannot comment to all of the factors that allowed the opposing team to get 3 infernals. I can however make some points that may be relevant. 

1. Dragon control is 100% on the entire team not just the jungler. If your teams laners are continually being pushed in they offer 0 support to contest nutural objectives. This can cause the dragons to go uncontested to the oposing team. 

2. Top lane. My personal favorite is to pressure the hell out of top lane and get some deep wards in their top side jungle. As soon as our team realises that their jungler has come top to help their laner out my team jumps on dragon or another play on bot side. 

3. Team mates asking for ganks. You would have had some experiance of "an over needy laner" continually demanding ganks... this can disrupt the jumglers ability to form vision / control over the nuteral objectives. 

4. Strong early junglers / weak early junglers. There are some jungle champs that can take dragons early solo. There are many champs that are not able to do so. The early game junglers tend to be agressive. Getting deep wards in the enemy jungle so they know whe  they can safely sneak an early solo dragon.


Hopefully some of that was relevant to your game / games.

nope none of it was, we were ahead by like 12 kills before that first dragon.

i was happily roaming around doing the junglers ganking for him (he ganked like once that game and afk farmed)

And we lost the first drag to him taking blue buff instead of coming to drag like we pinged.

And he lost the second drag because he initiated the drag by smiting.

He single handedly threw the game by basically being deadweight for the team.

> [{quoted}](name=YellowBrickRoad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=I55tQ5xP,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-01-28T13:15:38.810+0000)
>
> He single handedly threw the game by basically being deadweight for the team.

And this is the fallacy of bronze thinking. You have to adapt if you want to win. Shitters are everywhere in bronze. Some may be good at strategy but bad at mechanics, or vice versa. In the early stages of a game you can pretty much work out what level your teammates are on. And then it's time to adapt. 

[Take the following game for example](http://imgur.com/a/stopj). The mid laner went spaz throughout the whole game. They didn't adapt to a different situation, and as such, they played the worst on our team. The game was a clown fiesta, but the ones that adapted won the game. In most cases games are not decided by one missed skillshot, or how many dragons a team got. Sometimes a game can be decided by a late game teamfight, but the majority of games are decided by mindset and thinking. For another example of this is the game 2 of the Chiefs vs Tainted Minds played last Sunday. Chiefs were winning, but Tainted Minds were making a comeback until their top laner got lazy and greedy and wasn't thinking, got caught stealing a buff, which lead to a lost baron and teamfight, and losing the game. They didn't lose because Chiefs had more dragons though.

Ok it seems i have to explain further.

The game was lost by a late game teamfight you are correct.

The late game teamfight was lost because they had 124% gold efficiency for their damage items and were roughly equal with us in gold (mostly because the dragon gold efficiency made them equal with us when they were behind which meant we stopped stomping them into the ground every time we fought, instead they started picking up kills here and there in fights instead of getting aced which let them catch up), which means they had 24% more gold than us, effectively, give or take a few percent for hybrid items and tank items.

That means that those dragons alone in a 5v5 scenario made them stronger than us.

Those dragons were lost because at every point in the game where we were able to take a dragon and we signaled amumu to come he just afk farmed, which would promptly be followed by the enemy team arriving at dragon because someone on their team had the same exact thought.

Basically amumu did throw the game.

He didnt throw the game by missing a skill shot or anything like that.

He threw the game, by making a mistake multiple times, that led to a series of events that enabled an end game teamfight to be lost purely from gold efficiency.

They didnt have some god like cc on their team.

They werent especially good, like i said we started the game by just absolutely stomping them into the ground like, i was 7/1 by 10 minutes level of stomping them into the ground.

They were just plain stronger than us with the dragons.

Is it typical bronze fallacy to recoginse the direct cause for a loss, and instead of blaming that working backwards through the series of events that led to that direct cause to find the true cause of the problem?

Because thats what i did, thats what i do everytime i blame someone.

For instance if my adc dies 10 times to the fed to the balls warwick while under his tower am i going to blame that adc? No, a typical bronzie might.

But my first thought is "who initially fed warwick, before he had any kills" because the adc has an excuse, namely that warwick was already able to one shot him by the time he reached his lane, so who didnt have an excuse, who died when warwick was weak, who made the mistake.

Thats who i blame, not the adc.

Just like how i blame amumu for allowing the enemy team to recoup their strength, rather than my team for fucking up the teamfight.

it's still never one mans fault in a bronze/silver games. 3 infernals isn't a game decider. 4-5 tower advantage generally is. if you can't get drakes, just work on rotating and getting towers, if you can open an inhibitor before 20min whilst still having your middle tier towers in every lane, the game is generally over, bar some major screw up. Heck if you can open an inhibitor at that point in the game, it'd be pretty hard for the enemy to contest you taking dragons or if they don't push the super minions out as soon as possible, even baron.
Exactly. It's hardly ever one players fault. Maybe in a late game teamfight one player can screw up and cost his team the game, but what we are talking about here came way before that.

"bronzie junglers"

sorry haven't you been bronze 4-5 for like 3 seasons now?
one season, but one is close enough to 3 for you guys right?
For at least 2 years on the boards now you have been complaining like this
You have been complaining since then, about everything and nothing has changed.

Honestly as a jungle main, bot lane has more control on whether we junglers have dragon pressure at all or not.

The only thing you can do with bot lane losing to get dragons is to steal it in most scenarios (unless you can win a 2v3/3v3 down bot)

I did check your match history and couldn't find anything concerning 3 fire dragons but generally speaking if you've had 3 dragons taken against you (especially in bronze) you're already losing.

Fact is most dragons are taken (early especially) once you get kills bot/mid, meaning even forcing a dragon fight your gonna be at the disadvantage.

And even the fact that keeping the dragon warded tends to be more on the bot laners then the jungler

first dragon all 3 lanes were ahead and pushed in, the jungle just felt like taking blue buff.

Second dragon we were slightly behind but still able to contest jg smited early like a tard.

third dragon at that point was uncontestable.

first two i was there to help drag but couldnt do it solo.

Third i was defending our nexus.

>first dragon all 3 lanes were ahead and pushed in, the jungle just felt like taking blue buff.

So you were doing the dragon without your jungler?

>Second dragon we were slightly behind but still able to contest jg smited early like a tard.

Welcome to bronze.

nah not doing dragon setting up for it, the gist of what happened is i knew the enemy team was going to drag soon so i warded took scuttle and pinged amumu to come so we could get it first or atleast contest.

Instead we just had to watch helplessly as they 5 stacked the dragon while amumu took blue.

As for your second point, yep, thats why i bitch about being here all the time, i honestly dont understand how these players just cant grasp such simple things like that.

> [{quoted}](name=YellowBrickRoad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=I55tQ5xP,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-28T14:39:13.887+0000)
>
> Instead we just had to watch helplessly as they 5 stacked the dragon while amumu took blue.

There's the issue right there. You guys were spectating (i.e. doing nothing). If Amumu is miles away, why spectate? Get pushing a lane, you're not getting it without a smite. The jungler may be bad, but the team doesn't have to be also. Just say something nice to Amumu like, "Can we get the next dragon Amumu if I set up good vision beforehand?" If he doesn't respond to that then give up every dragon and do something else. 3 Infernals do not with the game on their own.

omfg... we were, do you know what a ward is?

I can see the dragon from the other side of the fucking map.

Stop assuming things.

Also yes, 3 dragons can win the game on their own.

Lets spell something out for you.

3 dragons is 24% increased gold efficiency on damage items.

If i have 10k gold worth of ad items.

I will actually have 12.4k gold worth of ad items.

Thats 8 kills worth of gold, for free. or 100 cs.

Per person on the team.

Lets say each member of the team is all building damage for whatever reason.

and each member of the team has bought 10k gold in ad, ignoring the fact thatd be a cancerous and crappy team comp.

thats 8 * 5, 40 kills of gold, or 500cs, or 12 THOUSAND gold.

That means that if both teams are 50 kills to 50 deaths, the one with 3 infernal drags is actually 90 kills/50 deaths in efficiency (assuming they each only have 10k gold in damage items which is stupid at 50 kills but it makes it a nice round number)


Do you get the point yet? infernal dragons are INSANELY gold efficient, they arent an ocean dragon where you get a nice little heal boost, or cloud dragons where you run faster, infernal dragons are pure stats, stats that make you stronger at full build than the enemy team.

3 infernal dragons, for teamfighting, is actually stronger than elder dragon, thats how gold efficient infernal drags are.

Edit: forgot to address one of your points, you mentioned being nice to amumu? nah.

I wont shit on him, but i wont be nice to him, youve gotta earn that kind of respect from me, i dont just give it out for free, it devalues it.

Gold efficiency and damage matter less in bronze/silver, as seen by how often huge leads are thrown away and how many games are still contested despite 5-6k gold leads. Yes in higher elo 5k gold lead is a guaranteed win, but in bronze or silver, it means very little. Picks, rotations, brief moments of coordination and the distribution of damage and cc matter far more in bronze/silver. 

Also the best drakes by winrate are actually earth drakes right now, 3 earth drakes is far stronger than 3 infernals and earth drakes are more impactful through the early, mid and middle-lategame, generally leading to map pressure leads which deny the enemy an extreme lategame scenario unless one team stupidly stalls the game out to the point where both teams have 3 or less towers.

out of the entire player base, only a select few are bad enough (or unlucky enough) to land themselves in bronze5 and have their elo tank so hard, that is becomes difficult to climb out. Think about the size of the server, even a small one like Oce. If you stuck the people who just lose the most, in a small space, to interact and fester, of course you'll see some pretty interesting things.

People often say that the difference between bronze 5 and silver 3 is nonexistant, but that isn't quite true. They are basically the same, and the differences aren't very noticable; however, there is a tiny tiny line, that makes the difference between drowning and staying just a few gasps away from the looming depths. 

Tbh I'll be be bronze this season, as I should have been last season, maybe as low as Bronze 5, and I don't quite really care about that, but for those of you who take this game more seriously. For those of you, for whom this game matters so dearly, I have sympathy for your plight.

Im fortunte that im just one of the unlucky ones, s6 was the first season i ever hit b5, but i was there for 800 games, i just could not climb solo in dyanmic queue, got as close as b2 then tanked striaght back to b5.

For comparison im 200 games into this season, and a couple days ago was the first time id been bronze 3 since well, 100 games ago, and bronze 4 since about 180 games ago.

As you can probably guess i wasnt b5 for that long this season either.

I mean i need to climb back to b2 then win about another 600 games before i can have my mmr catch up to where im at, because mmr resets dont fucking do shit apparently, but regardless im slowly making my way back to b1, emphasis on slowly, because i had something around 59% winrate, school holidays came on, then bam that 59% turned into 52%, i mean, its still above 50, but until all the kiddies go back to their mind prisons im going to be on a losing streak from having to deal with them.

It's not that simple. The TEAM is responsible for giving them 3 infernals. If your bot lane loses and you have no vision on the pit and all of your lanes have no pressure, you are NOT getting a single dragon.
Perhaps thats the junglers fault for not pressuring bot lane at all, perhaps its others for feeding/not warding etc.

But the point i'm making here is you can't just "GET THE DRAGON!". Because if you do in the scenario above, you first get aced, then they get the dragon then you lose more objectives. If you are in the losing situation the only way forward is to push your lanes. Nothing else. You can't just rush to the dragon pit without vision, when the enemies are fed. It's a death trap that happens in 99% of bronze games.

You assume our bot lane lost.

all 3 lanes were ahead.

The only person not trying to take dragons was our jungle.

Infact he didnt take a single dragon, didnt gank, didnt try to secure any objectives, and didnt even counter jungle, he just afk farmed all game.

Anymore stupid assumptions?

That's why I said it's not so simple. It's not stupid assumptions, it happens so often. But 3 infernals is not the reason why your team lost the game.

In the case that all three lanes are winning, why didn't your team get deep wards in their jungle, shove in the waves more and take the dragon? It's a team game. Your jungler may be garbage, but you can take the dragons if you are winning a game. Talk to the rest of your team and get them to come to take it.

Looking at it from the other side, you gotta ask HOW did the enemies even get dragons if all three lanes were winning? Maybe because your team backed at the wrong times, maybe because your team took stupid fights or dove when it wasn't necessary. Maybe your team wanted the dragon and went into a 4 v 5 without smite in hand, when if the enemies were taking a dragon, just let them have it and take some towers in return. You said your team was winning, it's must easier to secure a favourable objective trade when a team is winning.

Afk farming jungler? Use them as bait to get other objectives. Talk to them nicely and tell them they can split push in a side lane to create pressure. Trade the dragon for baron. There is always an answer. But the bottom line is your team screwed up, not just the jungler. You don't even need dragons when you are winning. That's like icing on the cake.

if the jungler wasn't responding to anything the team said, just report them for not communicating. It's a rare case of trolling.

We didnt need them, but the enemy did, which is the reason i wanted them.

Theres more than one reason to take a dragon, one of them, is deny dragons to the enemy team.

or is that a concept you dont understand?

Seriously a bronzie should not be having to teach you the finer points of deciding when to take an objective and why.

And a bronzie who doesn't understand PRIORITIES won't teach me. They can have those dragons, if in return you take their towers, inhibitors and baron and nexus. It's a fair trade.
infernal drakes do matter but even with comps that need them, the organisation, rotations, making picks and trading objectives is still more important, especially in the chaos that is bronze/silver.

I mean if you kill the enemy jungler and either a botlane or midlaner, you don't even need to have the jungler to take dragon though. Dragon isn't exactly that hard to rush down. Baron and rift herald is a little different, and you'll need a pretty susbstantial opportunity to get them without the jungler being up, but if your botlane can kill both the enemy botlaners for instance, then if the enemy jungler is top or you have deep wards, you can most certainly rush dragon with just the sup and adc, provided your midlaner can hold their midlaner at bay.

Other options include putting a ward down and baiting out a fight over dragon so that your toplaner can tp down and win you a big teamfight. The reason why the botlane duo of adc+sup is put botlane is because they can take dragon on their own really easily. Yes smite stealing is a threat, but with sufficient deepwarding by the support, dragon can be safely taken.
You're allowed to last hit the dragon. Stealing in bronze could not be easier. I do it all the time as a tank Janna support.
